intro: Senecio alcicornis, commonly known as the horned senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features distinctive, elongated bracts that resemble horns, giving it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Senecio alcicornis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
